question:
As a part of overseas deployment program of the Indian Navy, the vessel INS Tarkash visited Walvis Bay in September. Consider the following statements about Walvis Bay:
  1. It is located in Angola.
  2. It is located in the Atlantic Ocean.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: It is located in the African country of Namibia. It is the only natural harbour of the country. It has deep-water harbouring capacities for the ships. The region is of geopolitical significance. It has rich biodiversity and named after the southern right whale population that it attracts.  Statement 2 is correct: The bay is located in the Atlantic Ocean. Its northern neighbour Angola also has a coast along the Atlantic Ocean. On Namibia’s south is the South Africa. Namibia is a part of African Union. The visit by the INS Tarkash is a part of the bridges of friendship initiative.
